Package eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork

Class Serializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork.Serializer
  • public class Serializer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class supports dynamic object serialization, with the capability of reloading only parts of objects and saving only particular objects. It depends on Storage instances to abstract the file system.

    To declare an object as dynamic so that it is referenced by others with its id after serialization use the function registerId(Object) to automatically create a UUId or a registerId(Object, String) to specify a given id.

    Serialization supports non-enum primitive datatypes, lists, arrays and maps with String keys.

    To declare that a class field should not be saved, put the annotation @Serializer.Serialization(enabled=false) over it.

    Author:
    Emmanouil Krasanakis (maniospas@iti.gr)

    • Method Detail

      • clearSerializers

        public static void clearSerializers()
        This function removes all serializers from memory. This effectively unloads every contextual ego network without saving. Only use for testing.

      • getInstance

        public static Serializer getInstance​(Storage storage)
        Obtains a serializer that stores objects using a specific Storage object. Serializers are 1-1 mapped to storage objects.
        Parameters:
        path - The Storage object that manages file operations to store and load objects
        Returns:
        The serializer's instance

      • getStorage

        public Storage getStorage()
        Returns:
        The Storage instance used by the serializer

      • getObjectOrNull

        public java.lang.Object getObjectOrNull​(java.lang.String specificId)
        Retrieves an object registered to the given unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        specificId - The id to search for
        Returns:
        The registered object, null if no such object registered.
        See Also:
        registerId(Object), registerId(Object, String), #getRegisteredIdOrNull(Object)

      • getRegisteredId

        public java.lang.String getRegisteredId​(java.lang.Object object)
        Retrieves the unique identifier of an object registered in the serializer. This method throws an exception if no such object id is found.
        Parameters:
        object - A queried object to retrieve its id
        Returns:
        A String identifier of the registered object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the object has not been registered
        See Also:
        registerId(Object), #getObject(String)

      • registerId

        public java.lang.String registerId​(java.lang.Object object)
        Registers an automatically generated unique id (UUID) to the given object. If the object already has an id, the previously generated id is returned.
        Parameters:
        object - The given object.
        Returns:
        The generated or existing id.
        See Also:
        registerId(Object, String)

      • registerId

        public java.lang.String registerId​(java.lang.Object object,
                                   java.lang.String specificId)
        Registers a manually generated id to the given object. Use getObjectOrNull(String)!=null to check whether an id is available.
        Parameters:
        object - The given object
        specificId -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the id is already in use.
        See Also:
        registerId(Object)

      • removeFromStorage

        public void removeFromStorage​(java.lang.Object object)
        Removes the storage file associated with the given object. This does not affect whether the object is managed by the serializer and may be saved by future save(Object) calls.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to remove from storage.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on removal failure.

                      int levelsOfLoadingDemand)

      • setSavePermission

        public void setSavePermission​(java.lang.Object object,
                              boolean allowSave)
        Enables or disables saving for the registered object for the serializer. When enabled (default behavior) this will save the given object to a file determined by the path and registered object's serialization identifier.
        Parameters:
        object - The given object
        allowSave - Whether the serializer is allowed to save the given object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the given object is not registered, for example with registerId(Object)
        See Also:
        saveAllRegistered()

      • unregister

        public void unregister​(java.lang.Object object)
        Removes an object from the serializer. This object will no longer have a unique id and hence won't be stored in its own file.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to remove

      • removePreviousSaved

        public void removePreviousSaved()
        Empties the folder the serializer is initialized in from any previously saved data using the method Storage.deleteAll() of the serializer's storage manager.
